cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The 2nd ranked rain rate was recorded today with a peak rate of 16.6mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  5.69mm of rain fell during the storm's 3.2 hours length.  27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

storm.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.
Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 4th for length since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 10 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (192°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.8 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.0°C) and outside temperature (down 2.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 1373 m), and light levels (up 3982 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 104.7m higher than yesterday, 265.3m lower than the past week, 1373.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 565m and a peak of 1838m, averaging 1215.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Some rain can be expected, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and strong and powerful sunlight. Weather could become unsettled.
